title: DONALD TRUMP IS SELF-DESTRUCTING OVER ALICIA MACHADO
authors: Condé Nast, Tina Nguye, Lauren Le Vine, Kia Makarechi, James Warren, Chief Media Writer, Yohana Desta
content:
Elsewhere , Trump ’ s allies and surrogates were grimacing , publicly telling the media that they hoped Trump would stop talking about Machado and , with less than six weeks remaining until Election Day , go back to talking about the issues . Ben Carson mused aloud that Trump needed to “ disregard that and refocus , ” while Conway went on The View to say that she did “ reprimand ” Trump for his comments .
Machado herself has openly acknowledged her history , recently resurfaced by several right-wing outlets who dug up old reports that her daughter ’ s father was a Mexican drug kingpin and that she was accused of being involved in an attempted murder in 1998 . She later allegedly threatened the life of the judge who had issued a warrant for her then boyfriend . ( No charges were ever filed against Machado , according to Politico . ) As for the alleged “ sex tape , ” it appears that Trump is referring to video of her purportedly hooking up with a fellow contestant on La Granja , a Spanish-language reality-television show . ( A widely circulated excerpt from an actual pornographic video claimed to star Machado , but the Daily Beast reported that this was not the case after reviewing the tape . )
Machado , who admitted that she was no “ saint girl ” in the past , nonetheless dismissed Trump ’ s attacks as “ cheap lies and slander ” in an Instagram post where she appears draped in the American flag . In a further statement on Facebook , Machado continued to denounce the Republican nominee , whom she has accused of traumatizing her when she was in Miss Universe . “ This , of course , is not the first time the candidate insists on discrediting someone or insists on demoralizing women , minorities , and people of certain religions through his hateful campaign . This is definitely one of his most frightful characteristics . ”
Clinton , having successfully baited Trump into first defending his fat-shaming of Machado , and then revealing a prurient interest in her sex life , called her opponent “ unhinged ” Friday on Twitter . “ What kind of man stays up all night to smear a woman with lies and conspiracy theories ? ” she asked . “ Alicia deserves praise for courageously standing up to Trump 's attacks . And he has the gall to blame her—and say he ‘ helped ’ ? ” Clinton continued , referring to Trump ’ s claim to have saved Machado ’ s job by forcing her to lose weight . “ When something gets under Donald 's thin skin , he lashes out and ca n't let go . This is dangerous for a president . ”
After a few hours , Trump tweeted back , lamely , “ [ A ] t least you know I will be there , awake , to answer the call ! ” But the damage has been done . Instead of preparing for his next debate with Clinton , Trump is now into the fifth day of a feud with a woman who represents nearly all of the demographic groups that he has offended ( women , Latinos , immigrants ) , with a dash of fat-shaming and sexual slander to boot . Instead of letting the issue rest , as his advisers have begged him to do , Trump has escalated , bringing attention to his long history of demeaning and objectifying women . Now enraged , Trump is threatening to make Clinton ’ s husband ’ s infidelities a central part of their next debate—another self-destructive attack that will almost certainly boost public sympathy for Hillary while putting his own long , public history of marital indiscretions under the microscope . The Clinton campaign couldn ’ t have engineered a more brilliant masterstroke .
